column4: how do i get Keyring to auto-start without asking me for a password every time i turn the computer on? i've tried the pam-keyring thing suggested in the forms, but no luck
did you delete the existing keyring so the password can be set to your user password?
they're both the same to begin with. i only have one password
and you edited /etc/pam.d/gdm ?
and you are using Gnome with gdm correct? maybe you need to restart gdm... sudo invoke-rc.d gdm restart
wouldn't that be restarted when i reboot the computer?
indeed
have you successfully done this yourself?
yes
I think you should try deleting your keyring anyway
where is that?
~/.gnome2/keyrings/default.keyring
then restart gdm and relogin
cool, seems to have worked. i'll do a full reboot just to check
i did a full reboot, now it's asking me for my wireless network password
you'll need to enter it the first time, you deleted your keyring
now it's asking to make a new Keyring password
I can't remember if it should do that or not, try setting to your user password
ok, i'll try another reboot now
logging out and loggin in should be sufficient
nope, asking for a password again
have you done it according to these directions? http://staff.xiaoka.com/smoku/2007/05/17/password-hell-resolved/
note, seahorse isn't strictly necessary but it's nice to have
